title: Portrayal of Mughal rulers and religious harmony

content.prompt: A historian would most likely use the image in Source 1 as support for which of the following assertions?

choices.label: Mughal rule in India was generally supported by practitioners of Hinduism.
Mughal rulers were interested in portraying themselves as champions of religious harmony.
Mughal subjects resisted converting to Islam, despite the many benefits that doing so would confer.
Mughal art rejected realism and focused on allegorical and symbolic depictions of reality.

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Explain how claims or evidence support, modify, or refute a source's argument.
